hero.preHeadline: Are you exhausted from trying to be better?
hero.headline: The 3 Permissions You Need to Live Limitlessly with God
hero.dateLocation: June 19-21, 2025 | 3-Day Virtual Event | 90 Minutes Each Day
hero.intro: Stop trying to fix who you were. Start being who you are in Christ. Join Graham Cooke and Team Brilliant as they reveal the three permissions that end the exhausting cycle of performance Christianity and open the door to the limitless life Jesus actually purchased for you.

salesLetter.headline: I'm So Tired of Trying to Be Better...
paragraphs: If you've ever thought that - even for a moment - I want you to know something: That exhaustion isn't a failure. It's an invitation.

You're tired of the endless cycle: Falling back into old patterns you thought you'd overcome, feeling like you're not good enough for God's best, trying harder to be better but staying stuck in the same struggles, learning things that never seem to stick no matter how hard you try.

You know who you are in Christ... but you don't know how to live it out. You feel guilty when you rest, anxious about the future, and exhausted from trying to apply what you've learned through sheer willpower.
What if the problem isn't your commitment? What if you're just missing the right permissions?

Graham Cooke and Dionne van Zyl have walked this exact journey - from the exhaustion of performance Christianity to the rest of identity-based Kingdom living. They've discovered something revolutionary: You don't need to try harder. You need different permissions.

eventDays.description: You have permission to stop trying to fix who you were and start being who you are in Christ. Discover why your true identity in Christ gives you permission to stop the improvement project.

You have permission to live from rest instead of striving. Learn how to live FROM your new identity in practical, daily ways. Dionne will show you why rest isn't lazy - it's your natural state in Christ.
You have permission to learn relationally with God instead of academically about God. Understand why academic learning about God doesn't create lasting transformation.

features.headline: What You'll Experience During These 3 Life-Changing Days
features.subheading: Every session designed to move you from exhaustion to permission-based living
features.description: This isn't another conference about trying harder. These 90-minute sessions each day will systematically give you the three permissions that transform how you live with God - from performance to partnership, from striving to rest, from academic learning to relational growth.

speakers.headline: Meet Your Guides
speakers.subheading: Leaders who've walked the journey from performance Christianity to Kingdom rest

people.name: Graham Cooke
people.bio: Graham spent years in the exhausting cycle of performance Christianity before discovering the permissions that changed everything. Author of over 40 books and trusted by thousands worldwide, Graham will help you see that God never asked you to fix yourself - He gave you permission to BE who He says you already are.

people.name: Dionne van Zyl
people.bio: Dionne understands the struggle of knowing your identity but not knowing how to live it out. Through his own journey from striving to rest, he's developed practical methodologies for living from your new nature instead of working toward it. He'll show you exactly how to make this shift in your daily life.

people.name: Ray Higdon
people.bio: Ray brings years of experience in creating transformational experiences and has a heart for helping people discover their true identity in Christ. As your host, he'll guide you through breakthrough moments and ensure you get the most out of each session.

items.question: Is this event live or recorded?
items.answer: All three days are live virtual sessions with Graham, Dionne, and Ray. You'll be able to interact, ask questions, and experience real-time breakthrough moments.

items.question: How is this different from other Christian conferences or teachings?
items.answer: This event focuses specifically on permission-based living rather than performance Christianity. Instead of teaching you how to do more or be better, you'll discover the permissions you already have in Christ.

items.question: Is this suitable for new believers?
items.answer: Absolutely! This approach is especially helpful for those tired of performance Christianity and ready to discover what Kingdom living actually looks like.

items.question: What technology do I need to participate?
items.answer: Just a computer, tablet, or smartphone with internet access. We'll send you all the connection details after registration.
